sorular.soru: Which sign shows that you have to give way even in heavy snow?

feedback.metin: The only triangular sign pointing downwards is sign B-6. This sign indicates that you should give way to drivers on the intersecting road. The sign with the point up provides warnings. The round sign prohibits you from doing things or obliges you to do something. In addition to the sign with the point down, there are two other signs with a unique shape, namely a diamond-shaped sign (B-1) indicating a priority road and an octagonal sign (B-7), the so-called stop sign.

sorular.soru: To whom should you give way if they approach from the right at an equivalent intersection?

feedback.metin: Someone on rollerblades falls under the category of pedestrians, just like someone who is walking with a bicycle. A horse rider or handler of horses and livestock falls under the category of drivers. The horse's handler therefore also has priority if they approach from the right at an equivalent intersection.

sorular.soru: In which situation is it allowed to overtake on the right?

feedback.metin: Overtaking on the right is allowed just before and on a roundabout (upper left situation). It is also allowed on the right side of the block marking, to overtake vehicles on the left side of that block marking (bottom left situation). Overtaking on the right is also allowed when the vehicle in front of you is pre-sorted to turn left (bottom right situation). Overtaking on the right is not allowed in the upper right situation. There is no traffic jam and no block marking. In this case overtaking is only allowed on the left.

sorular.soru: Which sign warns of a speed bump?

feedback.metin: Sign J-1 warns of a poor road surface. Sign J-38 warns of a speed bump. Sign J-39 warns of a moving obstacle such as a bollard (a pole that can rise from the ground).

sorular.soru: In what situation should you give way to the other road user?

feedback.metin: In the two situations where the lesson car is turning left, it should give way to the other road user. In the upper left situation, the rule 'through traffic on the same road goes before traffic turning off' applies, where the lesson car continues straight on and the red car is turning off. The lesson car may go first here. In the upper right situation, the lesson car is turning off and it must give way to the red car continuing straight on. In the lower left situation, the rule 'the short bend goes before the long bend' applies and the red car that is turning right may go before the lesson car that is turning left. In the lower right situation, the lesson car that is turning right may go before the red car that is turning left.
